issue.title: Kubenetes deployments

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
Can we have deployment pack for kubernetes environment?

or better, a helm chart repository to install doccano into a kubernetes cluster.

Thanks,
---------
<!-- Please describe the feature: Which area of the library is it related to? What specific solution would you like? -->

body: @rsecob question about service port.    You have a "port" that defaults to 8000 and "service.port" that defaults to 80.  shouldn't there be only one service port with same value?

issue.title: How to use & connect mysql client on kubernetes?

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to use & connect mysql client ?
---------

```
apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: doccano
  name: doccano
  namespace: default
spec:
  progressDeadlineSeconds: 600
  replicas: 1
  revisionHistoryLimit: 10
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: doccano
      tier: frontend
  strategy:
    rollingUpdate:
      maxSurge: 25%
      maxUnavailable: 25%
    type: RollingUpdate
  template:
    metadata:
      creationTimestamp: null
      labels:
        app: doccano
        tier: frontend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ADMIN_USERNAME
          value: admin
        - name: ADMIN_EMAIL
          value: harsh.manvar@xxxx.com
        - name: ADMIN_PASSWORD
          value: admin
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: mysql://root:vbvf2lnhxxx@192.168.2.6:3306/doccano
        image: doccano/doccano
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: doccano
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8000
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 80
          name: https
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 250Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 150m
            memory: 128Mi
        terminationMessagePath: /dev/termination-log
        terminationMessagePolicy: File
      dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst
      restartPolicy: Always
      schedulerName: default-scheduler
      securityContext: {}
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
```

error i am getting:

```

  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 994, in _gcd_import
```

Environment

For persistence data i have to add volume ? if i also have to add volume then mount path documentation?

issue.title: Persistence path for Kubernetes?

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
I have set up Postgres in Kubernetes and also setup Doccano in Kubernetes however it's working well but wants to know the mount point for Kubernetes to attach Persistence volume.

My deployment.yaml

```
apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: doccano
  name: doccano
  namespace: default
spec:
  progressDeadlineSeconds: 600
  replicas: 1
  revisionHistoryLimit: 10
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: doccano
      tier: frontend
  strategy:
    rollingUpdate:
      maxSurge: 25%
      maxUnavailable: 25%
    type: RollingUpdate
  template:
    metadata:
      creationTimestamp: null
      labels:
        app: doccano
        tier: frontend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ADMIN_USERNAME
          value: admin
        - name: ADMIN_EMAIL
          value: harsh.manvar@xxxxx.com
        - name: ADMIN_PASSWORD
          value: admin
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://root:2lnhK06u@postgres:5432/doccano?sslmode=disable
        - name: ALLOW_SIGNUP
          value : "True"
        image: doccano/doccano
        volumeMounts:
        - name: doccano-data
          mountPath: app/staticfiles
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 300m
            memory: 400Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 150m
            memory: 128Mi
        name: doccano
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8000
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 80
          name: https
          protocol: TCP
      volumes:
      - name: doccano-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: doccano-data
```

right now i have used path : `app/staticfiles` but when pod restarts it delete all the files inside it that means files are not persistent at this path.

body: @scivm it is common to have a port non 80 at the container level since that is a privileged port, but its service to be 80 so that clients can use port 80 to talk to it.
Yes.  I understand now.  Thanks for the chart.
@Hironsan @rsecob are there any plans to create https://github.com/doccano/helm-charts to host the chart under ? If I may suggest, @rsecob could be a maintainer of that repo to maintain the chart

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote 👍 related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show 👍 if someone upvote, and 🤩 means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 👍
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 👍
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 👍
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 👍
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 👍
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 👍
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 🤩
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 👍
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 👍
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 🤩
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 🤩
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 👍
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 👍

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 🤩
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 👍
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 👍
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 👍
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 👍
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 👍
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 👍
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

body:
Hello, we, at Curie Institute are verry happy working with Doccano. We use it to annotate labels into our Patient's report.
We have developped a helm chart to deploy doccano on our Kubernetes Cluster. It is used for 1 year+.
[https://artifacthub.io/packages/helm/curie-df-helm-charts/doccano](https://artifacthub.io/packages/helm/curie-df-helm-charts/doccano)
